text:
“No, Rodion Romanovitch, Nikolay doesn’t come in!” 

Porfiry Petrovtich leaned forward. 

“This is a gloomy business. A modern case. A heart troubled.” 

Raskolnikov’s legs shook. He had resolved to jump. 

He committed the murder. 

He couldn’t take the money. 

He hid it under a stone. 

“Who is the murderer?” he whispered, breathless. 

Porfiry sank back, astonished. 

“Who is the murderer?” he echoed, surprised. 

Raskolnikov shuddered, feeling stabbed.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with his guilt and identity as a murderer while reflecting on the complexities of his actions and theories.
